intro: Wahlenbergia dunantii var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branching. This variant is distinguished by its smooth, hairless petals, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
